subject: Basketball
organizations: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
lead_paragraph: A member of the Rutgers women’s basketball team sued the radio personality Don Imus and CBS yesterday, claiming that Imus’s sexist and racist comments about the team damaged her reputation.Kia Vaughn filed the defamation of character lawsuit in state Supreme Court in the Bronx. Vaughn’s suit, believed to be the first by a player in the case, says that Imus; his former co-host Bernard McGuirk; CBS Corporation; and CBS Radio are legally responsible for damage done to her character and reputation. No dollar amount was listed in the suit.Imus referred to the players as “nappy-headed hos” on his nationally syndicated radio program in April. He was fired shortly after.A spokeswoman for CBS Radio declined to comment.
